column4: my problems started when it tried installing "lopenofice-org-writer2latex" then a lot of things failed after that
The problem is when you use a lot of packages unsupported by ubuntu.
do you know where i can at least see a log of the install? /var/log/apt doesn't have it
even so, it shoudl recognize packages that aren't supported and at least warn you
It did, when you first installed them.
yeah, well when they don't support the latest graphics cards you have to do that
they shouldn't pretend like you can upgrade
When you install "community supported software" it isn't supported by canonical.
that doesn't mean ubuntu should upgrade without warning you it might break your entire system
Uh, that's implicit in any upgrade. You should always back up data, but especially with system updates.
do you know of way of trying to resolve upgrade issues?
Best way is a fresh install, but what's the broken package?
i don't know b/c i closed the window and there's no log. but after restarting i have no network & the video is messed up
a lot of packages failed near the end
Uh, why'd you close the window? The generic fix is "sudo dpkg-reconfigure -a" to reconfigure all packages. Try that first.
i dunno it was stupid of me
